data.title: JSON
data.statement:
JSON (JavaScript Object Notation) is a lightweight data-interchange format. It is easy for humans to read and write. It is easy for machines to parse and generate.

You will receive an integer [[N]] and [[N]] lines [[line_i]]. Each [[line_i]] contains the data set name, followed by data fragments from that set. Your task is to group the data in the reading order according to the name of the set. Finally print a JSON according to the examples below.

Each line will have at least the name of the data set and an element

testCases.title: Test 1
testCases.testIn:
2
rabbits blue red white
dogs brown black white

dogs brown black white

dogs brown black white

dogs brown black white

rabbits blue red white
dogs brown black white

testCases.title: Validator 3

rabbits blue red white

rabbits blue red white

rabbits blue red white

data.stubGenerator:
read N:int

data.outputDescription: A line with JSON in the example format

lastVersion.statementHTML:
Goal

JSON (JavaScript Object Notation) is a lightweight data-interchange format. It is easy for humans to read and write. It is easy for machines to parse and generate.

You will receive an integer N and N lines line_i. Each line_i contains the data set name, followed by data fragments from that set. Your task is to group the data in the reading order according to the name of the set. Finally print a JSON according to the examples below.

Each line will have at least the name of the data set and an element
Input
Integer N
N lines line_i consisting of name and data
Output
A line with JSON in the example format
Constraints
1 <= N <= 10
3 <= line_i length <= 100
Example
Input
2
rabbits blue red white
dogs brown black white
Output
{"rabbits":["blue","red","white"],"dogs":["brown","black","white"]}
